required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dutch Acute HCV in HIV Study (DAHHS)
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of 12 Week Boceprevir in Addition to Standard of Care Therapy Consisting of Peginterferon-alpha-2b and Ribavirin for the Treatment of Acute HCV Genotype 1 in HIV Co-infected Patients. A Proof of Concept Feasibility Clinical Trial.

collaborator.agency: Academisch Medisch Centrum - Universiteit van Amsterdam (AMC-UvA)

brief_summary.textblock:
Prospective open label proof of concept feasibility interventional clinical trial in which 60 acute HCV genotype 1 patients co-infected with HIV will receive 12 weeks of boceprevir in addition to Standard Of Care Peginterferon + Ribavirin if they show a Rapid Viral Responds at week 4.
The primary hypothesis of this study is that the subset of patients with a Rapid Viral Responds after 4 weeks of triple therapy with boceprevir, peginterferon alpha-2b (P) and ribavirin (RVR4) can be successfully treated with a shorter 12-week triple therapy regimen.

primary_outcome.measure: Sustained Viral Response(SVR) 12 Weeks of Follow up After the End of All Therapy for the Rapid Viral Response at Week 4(RVR4) Population.
primary_outcome.description: The outcome is a number of the patients with an undetectable Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) RNA at week 4 that have an undetectable HCV RNA 12 weeks after end of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: SVR 12 Weeks After the End of All Therapy in the Entire Study Population (With or Without RVR4).
secondary_outcome.description: The outcome is a number of all patients who started treatment having an undetectable HCV RNA 12 weeks after the end of therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: SVR 12 Weeks After End of Therapy in Patients With Already a RVR at Week 1.
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients who were undetectable for HCV at week one that had an undetectable HCV RNA load 12 weeks after the end of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: SVR 12 Weeks After End of Therapy in Patients That Started Therapy ≤12weeks After the Presumed HCV Infection Date Versus Those After 12 Weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients having a undetectable HCV RNA 12 weeks after the end of treatment in the group patients that was treated within 12 week of calculated transmission date.

secondary_outcome.measure: Alterations of Biomarkers by Therapy Induced Viral Eradication: Viral Sequencing, Mutation Analysis, Gene Expression Analysis, and RNA Analysis.
Safety: Treatment Related (Serious) Adverse Events ((S)AE) and Treatment Discontinuation for (S)AE.
secondary_outcome.description: only serious adverse events are recorded in this secondary endpoint

arm_group.description: All patients were intended to be treated in the 12 week peginterferon, ribavirin and boceprevir arm.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Documented recent HCV genotype 1 infection (≤26 weeks old at the time of the baseline visit) according to definition mentioned below.
2. Plan to start a Standard Of Care therapy for acute HCV consisting of 24 weeks of Peginterferon + Ribavirin. HCV RNA plasma viral load at screening >1000 IU/ml.
3. A previously performed HCV RNA plasma measurement can be used for screening if <4 weeks old.
4. On HAART at the time of screening.
5. Minimum age 18 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Disallowed co-medication that cannot be stopped or replaced: Several potentially life-threatening drug-drug interactions (DDI) are possible when boceprevir is combined with other drugs. Therefore ALL co-medication, including over-the-counter drugs should be checked for potential DDI with DDI table in the Dutch summary of product characteristics (SPC, appendix A). If the co-medication is not mentioned in the SPC DDI table, www.HCV-druginteractions.org should be used.
2. Contraindications for the use of full dose of peginterferon alpha-2b or ribavirin: neutrophils <0,75×109/l or thrombocytes < 100.000×109/l or a Hb <6.2mmol/L, creatinine clearance <50ml/min).
3. History of liver cirrhosis or >F1 fibrosis on fibroscan. Inclusion of patients with a chronic well-controlled HBV (HBV-DNA below the limit of detection) with tenofovir, lamivudine or emtricitabine therapy is allowed if fibroscan excludes >F1 fibrosis. Fibroscan reports <2 years old can be used for screening. Fibroscan is not required for other patients at screening.
4. HAART was started <4 weeks before baseline visit.
5. Inability to switch to a HAART regimen consisting of 2 nucleoside/tide reverse transcriptase inhibitors + Raltegravir (Isentress®) 400mg BID or rilpivirine 25mg QD or atazanavir (Reyataz®) 300mg QD + ritonavir (Norvir®) 100mg QD.
6. Patient that virologically failed HAART in the past

group.title: Boceprevir
group.description: 12 week Boceprevir, Peginterferon and Ribavirin in RVR4 group

participants_list.participants: 8 patients had only screening visit, total enrollment: 65

outcome.title: Sustained Viral Response(SVR) 12 Weeks of Follow up After the End of All Therapy for the Rapid Viral Response at Week 4(RVR4) Population.
outcome.description: The outcome is a number of the patients with an undetectable Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) RNA at week 4 that have an undetectable HCV RNA 12 weeks after end of treatment.

measure.title: Sustained Viral Response(SVR) 12 Weeks of Follow up After the End of All Therapy for the Rapid Viral Response at Week 4(RVR4) Population.
measure.description: The outcome is a number of the patients with an undetectable Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) RNA at week 4 that have an undetectable HCV RNA 12 weeks after end of treatment.

outcome.title: SVR 12 Weeks After the End of All Therapy in the Entire Study Population (With or Without RVR4).
outcome.description: The outcome is a number of all patients who started treatment having an undetectable HCV RNA 12 weeks after the end of therapy

group.title: Boceprevir, Peginterferon and Ribavirin
group.description: 12 week boceprevir, peginterferon and ribavirin in intention to treat group

measure.title: SVR 12 Weeks After the End of All Therapy in the Entire Study Population (With or Without RVR4).
measure.description: The outcome is a number of all patients who started treatment having an undetectable HCV RNA 12 weeks after the end of therapy

outcome.title: SVR 12 Weeks After End of Therapy in Patients With Already a RVR at Week 1.
outcome.description: The number of patients who were undetectable for HCV at week one that had an undetectable HCV RNA load 12 weeks after the end of treatment
outcome.population: All patients having a rapid viral response at week 4 had a sustained viral response at 12(SVR12) weeks after treatment.

measure.title: SVR 12 Weeks After End of Therapy in Patients With Already a RVR at Week 1.
measure.description: The number of patients who were undetectable for HCV at week one that had an undetectable HCV RNA load 12 weeks after the end of treatment
measure.population: All patients having a rapid viral response at week 4 had a sustained viral response at 12(SVR12) weeks after treatment.

outcome.title: SVR 12 Weeks After End of Therapy in Patients That Started Therapy ≤12weeks After the Presumed HCV Infection Date Versus Those After 12 Weeks.
outcome.description: The number of patients having a undetectable HCV RNA 12 weeks after the end of treatment in the group patients that was treated within 12 week of calculated transmission date.
outcome.population: 5 patients were treated within 12 weeks after calculated transmission date. All other patients were treated between 12 and 26 weeks after calculated transmission date.

measure.title: SVR 12 Weeks After End of Therapy in Patients That Started Therapy ≤12weeks After the Presumed HCV Infection Date Versus Those After 12 Weeks.
measure.description: The number of patients having a undetectable HCV RNA 12 weeks after the end of treatment in the group patients that was treated within 12 week of calculated transmission date.
measure.population: 5 patients were treated within 12 weeks after calculated transmission date. All other patients were treated between 12 and 26 weeks after calculated transmission date.

outcome.title: Alterations of Biomarkers by Therapy Induced Viral Eradication: Viral Sequencing, Mutation Analysis, Gene Expression Analysis, and RNA Analysis.
outcome.population: data were not collected during this study

measure.title: Alterations of Biomarkers by Therapy Induced Viral Eradication: Viral Sequencing, Mutation Analysis, Gene Expression Analysis, and RNA Analysis.
measure.population: data were not collected during this study

outcome.title: Safety: Treatment Related (Serious) Adverse Events ((S)AE) and Treatment Discontinuation for (S)AE.
outcome.description: only serious adverse events are recorded in this secondary endpoint
outcome.population: 57 patients started treatment and were at risk

group.title: Boceprevir, Peginterferon and Ribavirin
group.description: 12 week boceprevir, peginterferon and ribavirin in intention to treat group

measure.title: Safety: Treatment Related (Serious) Adverse Events ((S)AE) and Treatment Discontinuation for (S)AE.

group.title: Boceprevir
group.description: 12 week Boceprevir, Peginterferon and Ribavirin in RVR4 group

event.description: One myocardial infarction in a patient with a high-grade left anterior descending artery stenosis that was stented uneventfully (hemoglobin (Hb) 8∙7 mmol/L at the time of the infarction).
One anemia (Hb 5·1 mmol/L) for which a transfusion was given and the ribavirin dose was decreased.
One suspected transient ischemic attack that resolved spontaneously and with normal MRI findings (Hb 6∙6 mmol/L)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
